metadata.title: CVE-2017-5053 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds read in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 57.0.2987.133 forLinux, Windows, and Mac, and 57.0.2987.132 for Android, allowed a remoteattacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTMLpage, related to Array.prototype.indexOf.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5053` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'Ubuntu touch end-of-life').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
